name: NPR
text:
Google CEO Sundar Pichai apologized in an internal email over the fallout of Timnit Gebru's dismissal. Thousands of employees publicly criticized the top Black scientist's ouster as "research censorship."
https://t.co/MS64PuaNKb

name: NPR
text:
Europe's soccer governing body is investigating after a Champions League official allegedly made a racist remark about a Black player. The official faces a 10-game ban if found guilty.
https://t.co/GWN1AkeFyI

name: NPR
text:
NEW: The U.S. reported more than 3,000 deaths from COVID-19, the highest daily death toll to date, as infections and hospitalizations continue to soar across the nation.
https://t.co/8kAfdxVdY1

name: NPR
text:
California's iconic old-growth redwoods — some having survived for 1,000 to 2,000 years now — are incredibly resilient and built to survive fires.

But even they may find it harder to rebound amid the mounting impacts of climate change.
https://t.co/IVkBcDT0D8

name: NPR
text:
Watch Paramore's Hayley Williams perform three songs — including "Dead Horse" and "Pure Love" — for a special Tiny Desk quarantine concert.
https://t.co/0cGKmiwz69

name: NPR
text:
Ace test pilot Chuck Yeager died on Monday. He's remembered here at NPR for his call of the first-ever landing of a U.S. space shuttle, when the Columbia touched down in California in 1981. https://t.co/Ixq1rRehnl

Thanks to our friends at @npr_rad for the clip. https://t.co/ce1ldRT3fU

name: NPR
text:
The leader of an anti-government white supremacist militia group and former sheriff's deputy has been convicted of hate crime charges after a 2017 pipe bomb attack on a Minnesota mosque.
https://t.co/fQTFvd6jF9

name: NPR
text:
Brazil's Gol Airlines is the first carrier to bring Boeing's 737 Max back into service after it was grounded over 2 deadly crashes. Gol says it will accommodate anyone who wants to avoid the plane.
https://t.co/A1RhsprPW0
